title: Back to the future for no-deal Chancellor but fiscal risks loom
text:
Chancellor Sajid Javid promised a “comprehensive economic response” to help steer the nation through a no-deal Brexit, but the Institute for Fiscal Studies has set out its stall against a wild spending spree in today’s Green Budget.

Should Boris Johnson somehow evade the clutches of the Benn Act and engineer a departure on October 31, fragile public finances leave him little room for manoeuvre, according to the UK’s respected fiscal referee. In Theresa May’s cabinet, Javid once called for “shock and awe” tactics in the event of a crash-out, but the IFS says any stimulus should follow the guidance of the International Monetary Fund and be “timely, targeted and temporary”.
